I don't support what Sterling (Clipper's owner) said but wonder how 
something said in the privacy of his own home secretly recorded can be used 
against him. Regardless of whether state or federal law governs the 
situation, it is almost always illegal to record a phone call or private 
conversation to which you are not a party, do not have consent from at 
least one party, and could not naturally overhear. In California both 
parties must consent. In addition, federal and many state laws do not 
permit you to surreptitiously place a bug or recording device on a person 
or telephone, in a home, office or restaurant to secretly record a 
conversation between two people who have not consented. Federal law and 
most state statutes also make disclosing the contents of an illegally 
intercepted telephone call illegal. Seems to me the girlfriend should be 
arrested. I also think the public comments made by Larry Johnson (former 
Nick's NBA player) and others to be just as racist as the comments made by

players, coaches & owners? I also believe that Adam Silver's (NBA 
Commissioner) action to make an example out of Sterling and not others is
